instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> error
threads.message:
When initializing the system at the end of the bar, it restarts. I tried ASD TEST and it shows an error ''Error: 0x800000000003, Cannot Load 'EFI/Drivers/TestSupport.efi''.
Status: 0x0000003

I cleaned up the eviction from the ME Region, but it did not solve it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> error
threads.message:
Install Windows on test SSD, if possible.
Then start installing drivers and see when system crashes; probably GPU driver.

You can also try FULL known good BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> error
threads.message:
There's a bug running AHT or ASD EFI on some older machines that got Mojave BootROM update. (for some of them the bug was fixed with a later update) ASD OS runs fine.
Exclude software issue first. Also <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> solder joints rework.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> error
threads.message:
It is not going up through Windows 10 on the external ssd. 

I identified that the speaker connector is damaged and the left cooler screw base is damaged.Does this influence the connection to the machine?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> error
threads.message:
I solved the <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and replaced it, but without result.

[ATTACH type="full"]59503[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> error
threads.message:
Probably bad GPU; hardare mod available to disable it.

Do PRAM reset, just in case.
Do NOT boot from USB preinstalled Windows 10; run new installation.
